chargeHist.descr: Child Abuse - Intentionally Cause Great Bodily Harm

result.execSummary:
The defendant Roy Kennard Weatherall was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Roy Kennard Weatherall is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Roy Kennard Weatherall was found guilty of Trafficking of a Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.051(1).
  • Roy Kennard Weatherall was found guilty of Trafficking of a Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.051(1).
  • Roy Kennard Weatherall was found guilty of Soliciting a Child for Prostitution, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.08.
  • Roy Kennard Weatherall was found guilty of Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).
  • Roy Kennard Weatherall was found guilty of 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).
  • Roy Kennard Weatherall was found guilty of Solicitation of Prostitutes, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 944.32.
  • Roy Kennard Weatherall was found guilty of Pandering/Pimping, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 944.33(2).
  • Roy Kennard Weatherall was found guilty of Solicitation of Prostitutes, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 944.32.
  • Roy Kennard Weatherall was found guilty of Intimidate Witness/Person Charged/Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.43(7).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
As to each count: Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and imposed mandatory surcharges.
The Court ordered the defendant to pay DNA surcharges AND all other applicable costs and any other surcharges and assessments to be collected by the Department of Corrections from 25 % of prison funds and to convert to civil judgment upon release to/from extended supervision.
Consecutive to: Counts 7, 8, and 12 with credit for 0 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes:
Seek and maintain full time employment.
Obtain high school diploma or GED.
Vocational/educational training.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms and body armor and that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.

No contact with victims, their families, residences and places of employment.
No contact with anyone under the age of 18 without agent's approval.
The Court informed the defendant that he cannot engage in an occupation or participate in a volunteer position that requires him to work or interact primarily and directly with children under 16 years of age.

Sex offender assessment and comply with recommended treatment.
Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
Pursuant to 973.048, defendant to comply with the reporting requirements under 301.45 for the sex offender registry with DOC.

Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety.
Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Any other sentence, with credit for 268 days time served.

Per Order Dated August 12, 2021, Appeal No. 2020AP117-W, 
IT IS ORDERED that the petition for review is denied, without costs.

Per Order Dated April 6, 2021, Appeal No. 2020AP117-W, 
IT IS ORDERED that the petition for a writ of habeas corpus, is denied without costs to any party.

Per order dated August 3, 2021, Appeal No. 2020AP000117 W, IT IS ORDERED that the courts grants permission to proceed without payment of the filing fee.  This order waives only the filing fees in the Supreme Courrt.  It is not a determination of indigency for any other purpose.  Indigency may be reevaluated if a request is received for waiver of other fees based on indigency.
Per order dated June 30, 2021, Appeal No. 2020AP117-W, IT IS ORDERED that the request is granted, and the amended statement in support is accepted for filing.

Per Order Dated May 5, 2021, Appeal No. 2020AP117-W,
IT IS ORDERED that the motion is denied.  The 30-day period in which to file a petition for review may not be enlarged.  First Wisconsin National Bank of Madison v. Nicholaou 87 Wis. 2d 360, 274 N.W.2d 704 (1979): 
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED the motion itself shall be deemed to be a timely but nonconforming petition for review.  However, a statement in support of the petition, conforming to the requirements of Wis. Stat. Rules 809.62(2) and (4), must be filed with the clerk of this court by July 6, 2021.  If the statement is not filed by that time, this petition will be summarily dismissed.
Per order dated April 6, 2021, Appeal No. 2020AP117-W, IT IS ORDERED that the petition for a writ of habeas corpus, is denied without costs to any party.

Per order dated February 13, 2020, Appeal No. 2020AP000117 W, IT IS ORDERED that the court grants permission to proceed without payment of the filing fee.  This order waives only the filing fees in the Court of Appeals.  It is not a determination of indigency for any other purpose.  Indigency may be reevaluated if a request is recieved for waiver of other fees based on indigency.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #7
As to count 13.

Defendant Roy Kennard Weatherall in court with attorney James Eric Goldmann.  Defendant Roy Kennard Weatherall in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Presentence Investigation reviewed.  Additions and corrections not made.  Statements by state, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by Hazel W. and Ruth M.
AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 20 YEARS consecutive to counts 7, 8 and 12, with credit for 0 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 15 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS. 
AS TO COUNT 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 25 YEARS concurrent with any other sentence, with credit for 268 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 15 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 10 YEARS.  
AS TO COUNT 5:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 15 YEARS concurrent with any other sentence, with credit for 268 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 10 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.  
AS TO COUNT 6: 
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 6 YEARS concurrent with any other sentence, with credit for 268 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS. 
AS TO COUNT 7:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 15 YEARS consecutive to counts 1, 8 and 12, with credit for 0 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 10 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.  
AS TO COUNT 8:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 6 YEARS  consecutive to counts 1, 7 and 12, with credit for 0 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.  
AS TO COUNT 11:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 6 YEARS concurrent with any other sentence, with credit for 268 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.  
AS TO COUNT 12:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 6 YEARS consecutive to counts 1, 7 and 8, with credit for 0 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 
YEARS.  
AS TO COUNT 14:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 10 YEARS concurrent with any other sentence, with credit for 268 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.  Conditions of extended supervision:

As to each count: Conditions of extended supervision:
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with recommended treatment.
*Sex offender assesment  and comply with recommended treatment.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.
*No contact with victims, their families, residences and places of employment.
*Seek and maintain fulltime employment
*Obtain high school diploma or GED
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy
*Vocational/educational training
*No contact with anyone under the age of 18 without agent's approval

As to each count: Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample and imposed mandatory surcharges.
The Court ordered the defendant to pay DNA surcharges AND all other applicable costs and any other surcharges and assessments to be collected by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds and to convert to civil judgment upon release to/from extended supervision.  

The Court informed the defendant that he cannot engage in an occupation or participate in a volunteer position that requires him to work or interact primarily and directly with children under 16 years of age.  
Pursuant to 973.048, defendant to comply with the reporting requirements under 301.45 for the sex offender registry with DOC.  

AS TO COUNT 13:
Case adjourned to 2-2-2015 at 8:30 a.m. for sentencing hearing in Branch 10.

Court informs defendant he is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program or Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearmsand body armor and that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into to the custody of the MIlwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

- Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment;
